meanings.definition: A person or thing that inclines or leans.
meanings.sent1: The incliners on the playground enjoyed swaying back and forth on the seesaw.
meanings.sent2: The tree's incliners were evident as it leaned slightly to one side.
meanings.sent3: The incliners at the party couldn't resist joining the dance floor whenever their favorite song played.
meanings.sent4: The incliners of the tower made it look like it was about to topple over in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The incliners in the row of chairs created a wave-like effect as people shifted in their seats.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that tilts or adjusts the angle of something.
meanings.sent1: The incliners on the camera tripod allowed for precise adjustments to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: The incliners on the solar panel system ensured optimal sunlight exposure throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The incliners in the car seat made it easy to find a comfortable driving position.
meanings.sent4: The incliners on the telescope enabled astronomers to observe celestial bodies from different angles.
meanings.sent5: The incliners on the drawing board helped artists work on their sketches at varying inclinations.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are inclined towards a particular belief or action.
meanings.sent1: The incliners in the environmental club were passionate about recycling and reducing waste.
meanings.sent2: The incliners in the debate team strongly supported the idea of free speech.
meanings.sent3: The incliners in the book club always had lively discussions about their favorite novels.
meanings.sent4: The incliners in the hiking group loved exploring new trails and challenging routes.
meanings.sent5: The incliners in the charity organization dedicated their time to helping those in need.
